page.title: 16ETHEL AT SCHOOL IN 1900
page.content: Ethel, born June 19th 1891, remembers her schooldays. The four year olds in the classroom used slates and slate pencils. Older children, taught in the big room by Miss Goldsmith,Headmistress ,and pupil teacher, Miss Jones, used pens and pencils. Ethel learned the 3 R's and singing , sewing and scripture. Ethel's sewing task for the year was to make a nightdress and knit long clock patterned rib-topped stockings for her six feet tall Headmistress. Girls wore white pinafores to protect their school clothes. She disliked pole drill. Discipline was strict , boys were caned on their backs , girls on the hand or they stayed in after school to write lines. Ethel left school at 12 years of age.
